sn46.54:11.2.pli: ‘kathaṁ bhāvitā panāvuso, mettācetovimutti, kiṅgatikā hoti, kiṁparamā, kiṁphalā, kiṁpariyosānā?
sn46.54:11.2.en: ‘But reverends, how is the heart’s release by love developed? What is its destination, apex, fruit, and end?

sn46.54:12.1.pli: Kathaṁ bhāvitā ca, bhikkhave, mettācetovimutti, kiṅgatikā hoti, kiṁparamā, kiṁphalā, kiṁpariyosānā?
sn46.54:12.1.en: And how is the heart’s release by love developed? What is its destination, apex, fruit, and end?

sn46.54:12.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu mettāsahagataṁ satisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāveti …pe…
sn46.54:12.2.en: It’s when a mendicant develops the heart’s release by love together with the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion,

sn46.54:12.9.pli: Subhaparamāhaṁ, bhikkhave, mettācetovimuttiṁ vadāmi, idhapaññassa bhikkhuno uttarivimuttiṁ appaṭivijjhato.
sn46.54:12.9.en: The apex of the heart’s release by love is the beautiful, I say, for a mendicant who has not penetrated to a higher freedom.

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 46
6. Discussion
54. Full of Love

sn20.3:1.3.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhuno mettācetovimutti abhāvitā abahulīkatā so suppadhaṁsiyo hoti amanussehi.
sn20.3:1.3.en: In the same way any mendicant who has not developed and cultivated the heart’s release by love is easy prey for non-humans.

sn20.3:1.5.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhuno mettācetovimutti bhāvitā bahulīkatā so duppadhaṁsiyo hoti amanussehi.
sn20.3:1.5.en: In the same way a mendicant who has developed and cultivated the heart’s release by love is hard prey for non-humans.

sn20.3:1.7.pli: ‘mettā no cetovimutti bhāvitā bhavissati bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā’ti.
sn20.3:1.7.en: ‘We will develop the heart’s release by love. We’ll cultivate it, make it our vehicle and our basis, keep it up, consolidate it, and properly implement it.’

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 20
1. Similes
3. Families

an10.219:4.2.pli: daharatagge ce so ayaṁ kumāro mettaṁ cetovimuttiṁ bhāveyya, api nu kho pāpakammaṁ kareyyā”ti?
an10.219:4.2.en: Suppose a child had developed the heart’s release by love from their childhood on. Would they still do any bad deed?”

an10.219:6.1.pli: “Bhāvetabbā kho panāyaṁ, bhikkhave, mettācetovimutti itthiyā vā purisena vā.
an10.219:6.1.en: “This heart’s release by love should be developed by women or men.

an10.219:6.7.pli: Evaṁ bhāvitā kho, bhikkhave, mettā cetovimutti anāgāmitāya saṁvattati, idha paññassa bhikkhuno uttari vimuttiṁ appaṭivijjhato.
an10.219:6.7.en: The heart’s release by love developed in this way leads to non-return for a wise mendicant here who has not penetrated to a higher freedom.

an6.13:1.4.pli: ‘mettā hi kho me cetovimutti bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā;
an6.13:1.4.en: ‘I’ve developed the heart’s release by love. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.

an6.13:1.7.pli: Aṭṭhānametaṁ, āvuso, anavakāso yaṁ mettāya cetovimuttiyā bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya;
an6.13:1.7.en: It’s impossible, reverend, it cannot happen that the heart’s release by love has been developed and properly implemented,

an6.13:1.9.en: For it is the heart’s release by love that is the escape from ill will.’

dn33:2.2.76.en: For it is the heart’s release by love that is the escape from ill will.’

dn34:1.7.36.en: ‘I’ve developed the heart’s release by love. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.

dn34:1.7.41.en: For it is the heart’s release by love that is the escape from ill will.’

an11.15:1.1.pli: “Mettāya, bhikkhave, cetovimuttiyā āsevitāya bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya ekādasānisaṁsā pāṭikaṅkhā.
an11.15:1.1.en: “Mendicants, you can expect eleven benefits when the heart’s release by love has been cultivated, developed, and practiced, made a vehicle and a basis, kept up, consolidated, and properly implemented.

an11.15:2.3.pli: Mettāya, bhikkhave, cetovimuttiyā āsevitāya bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya ime ekādasānisaṁsā pāṭikaṅkhā”ti.
an11.15:2.3.en: You can expect eleven benefits when the heart’s release by love has been cultivated, developed, and practiced, made a vehicle and a basis, kept up, consolidated, and properly implemented.”

sn20.5:2.1.pli: “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhuno mettācetovimutti bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā, tassa ce amanusso cittaṁ khipitabbaṁ maññeyya;
sn20.5:2.1.en: “In the same way, suppose a mendicant has developed the heart’s release by love, has cultivated it, made it a vehicle and a basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it. Should any non-human think to overthrow their mind,

sn20.5:2.4.pli: ‘mettā no cetovimutti bhāvitā bhavissati bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā’ti.
sn20.5:2.4.en: ‘We will develop the heart’s release by love. We’ll cultivate it, make it our vehicle and our basis, keep it up, consolidate it, and properly implement it.’

an8.1:2.1.pli: “Mettāya, bhikkhave, cetovimuttiyā āsevitāya bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya aṭṭhānisaṁsā pāṭikaṅkhā.
an8.1:2.1.en: “Mendicants, you can expect eight benefits when the heart’s release by love has been cultivated, developed, and practiced, made a vehicle and a basis, kept up, consolidated, and properly implemented.

an8.1:2.4.pli: Mettāya, bhikkhave, cetovimuttiyā āsevitāya bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya ime aṭṭhānisaṁsā pāṭikaṅkhāti.
an8.1:2.4.en: You can expect these eight benefits when the heart’s release by love has been cultivated, developed, and practiced, made a vehicle and a basis, kept up, consolidated, and properly implemented.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 8
1. Love
1. The Benefits of Love

an1.17:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppanno vā byāpādo nuppajjati uppanno vā byāpādo pahīyati yathayidaṁ, bhikkhave, mettā cetovimutti.
an1.17:1.1.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that prevents ill will from arising, or, when it has arisen, abandons it like the heart’s release by love.

an1.17:1.2.pli: Mettaṁ, bhikkhave, cetovimuttiṁ yoniso manasi karoto anuppanno ceva byāpādo nuppajjati uppanno ca byāpādo pahīyatī”ti.
an1.17:1.2.en: When you attend properly on the heart’s release by love, ill will does not arise, or, if it has already arisen, it’s given up.”

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 1
2. Giving Up the Hindrances
11–20

an3.68:7.2.en: You should say: ‘The heart’s release by love.’

an3.68:7.3.pli: Tassa mettaṁ cetovimuttiṁ yoniso manasi karoto anuppanno ceva doso nuppajjati uppanno ca doso pahīyati.
an3.68:7.3.en: When you attend properly on the heart’s release by love, hate doesn’t arise, or if it’s already arisen it’s given up.

mlDocs.title:

7. The Great Chapter
68. Followers of Other Paths

mn99:24.3.pli: Evaṁ bhāvitāya kho, māṇava, mettāya cetovimuttiyā yaṁ pamāṇakataṁ kammaṁ na taṁ tatrāvasissati, na taṁ tatrāvatiṭṭhati.
mn99:24.3.en: When the heart’s release by love has been developed and cultivated like this, any limited deeds they’ve done don’t remain or persist there.

mn99:24.5.pli: evameva kho, māṇava …pe… evaṁ bhāvitāya kho, māṇava, mettāya cetovimuttiyā yaṁ pamāṇakataṁ kammaṁ na taṁ tatrāvasissati, na taṁ tatrāvatiṭṭhati.
mn99:24.5.en: In the same way, when the heart’s release by love has been developed and cultivated like this, any limited deeds they’ve done don’t remain or persist there.
